com.camerontec.catalys.server.component

Class ExposableMBeanComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.AbstractConfigurable
      • com.camerontec.catalys.server.component.ComponentHelper
        • com.camerontec.catalys.server.component.ExposableMBeanComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IComponent, IHasAttributes, IConfigurable, IRegisterable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ScheduledTask, Task

    public abstract class ExposableMBeanComponent
extends ComponentHelper
    Base implementation of a class which can register itself with a JMX server if present.

    This is also an IComponent so it has attributes which are typically used to construct the JMX ObjectName.

    All object domain names are assumed to be in the form: 

     prefix.suffix

    Object name is constructed in the openComponent method. Subclasses can override methods to set the domain prefix and suffix as well as the list of property/values which defines a particular instance.

      • getDomainPrefix

        public String getDomainPrefix()
        This should identify the domain prefix for this instance.

        It can assume that all this instance's properties have been read.

        Default implementation returns null.

        Returns:
        This object's domain prefix. Can be null.

      • getDomainSuffix

        public abstract String getDomainSuffix()
        This should identify the domain suffix for this instance.
        Returns:
        This object's domain suffix. Can be null.

      • getMBean

        public abstract Object getMBean()
        Return the managed bean that is actually registered with JMX. If the object in question is, itself, an MBean it will override this to simply return "this". Alternately, it could return an associated ModelMBean, for example.
        Returns:
        Managed Bean corresponding to this object.

      • getObjectName

        public ObjectName getObjectName()
        This object's object name.
        Returns:
        Object name which can be null if this object has not been registered with JMX.

      • getPropertiesString

        public abstract String getPropertiesString()
        This should be a unique identifier of this instance within its domain in the standard JMX property/value format for object names. Namely: 
           property=value[,property=value]*

        It can assume that all this instance's properties have been read.

        Returns:
        Property/Values string for this instance.

                      throws Exception

        Overrides:

        Returns:
        Previous open state.
        Throws:
